title: Deals: Apple Watch Series 10 for $299, M2 MacBook Air for $699, AirPods Pro 2 for $170
description: Amazon is offering some all-time-low prices on some fantastic Apple products right now, including the latest Apple Watch Series 10 for just $299 (down from $399 retail), AirPods Pro 2 with Hearing Aid functionality for just $169.99 (down from $249), and the M2 MacBook Air 13″ 16GB / 256GB model for just $699. What’s not ... Read More
author: OSXDaily
excerpt: Amazon is offering some all-time-low prices on some fantastic Apple products right now, including the latest Apple Watch Series 10 for just $299 (down from $399 retail), AirPods Pro 2 with Hearing …
text: Amazon is offering some all-time-low prices on some fantastic Apple products right now, including the latest Apple Watch Series 10 for just $299 (down from $399 retail), AirPods Pro 2 with Hearing Aid functionality for just $169.99 (down from $249), and the M2 MacBook Air 13″ 16GB / 256GB model for just $699. What’s not to love about these great deals? Why pay more than you have to, check out the deals below! Apple Watch Series 10 – $299 (down from $399) Amazon is taking 25% off the price of brand new Apple Watch Series 10 models in various color and band options. Apple Watch Series 10 features a 42mm always-on display, fitness and activity tracking, heart rate monitor, ECG, crash detection, fall detection, Emergency SOS, ovulation tracking, GPS, pinch gestures, water resistance, voice control, Siri commands, all-day battery life, and more. Get Apple Watch Series 9 for $299 (check out color options, down from $399 MSRP) M2 MacBook Air 13″ for $699 Amazon is offering the M2 MacBook Air 13″ model for just $699 in the 16GB RAM / 256GB configuration, cutting 30% off the original $999 MSRP. Yes Apple just updated the MacBook Air lineup with M4 chips, but those start at $999, so if you’re looking to save some cash and you don’t mind having a prior generation chip, the M2 is available at a great place and is no slouch. The M2 chip supports Apple Intelligence and is speedy and energy efficient, making this a great portable Mac for an unusually low price point. M2 MacBook Air 16/256 – $699 AirPods Pro 2 with Hearing Aid functionality – $169.99 (down from $249) AirPod Pro 2 are both popular and powerful earbuds, but one of the most unique features of the wireless headphones is that they include clinic-grade hearing aid functionality that is appropriate for mild to moderate hearing loss. That’s in addition to the standard great AirPods Pro features, like high fidelity sound, active noise cancellation, Spatial Audio, water and sweat resistance, custom fit, transparency mode for ambient sounds, ear detection, Siri command support, and a USB-C charging case. AirPods Pro 2 – $169.99 (down from $249) AirTags 4-pack for $70 (down from $99) Amazon is still offering a 4-pack of AirTag trackers for just $70, down from the $99 retail price. With four of these personal trackers you’ll be able to track everything you can think of, whether it’s keeping an eye on your dog, cat, briefcase, purse, luggage, package, backpack, car, bike, scooter, emotional support donkey, or whatever else you might find suitable to track with the powerful Apple Find My network. AirTags – 4-pack – $69.99 (down from $99) FTC: OSXDaily is an affiliate partner with Amazon, meaning if you click a link and make a purchase, we may receive a small payment which goes towards keeping the site running.
html:
Amazon is offering some all-time-low prices on some fantastic Apple products right now, including the latest Apple Watch Series 10 for just $299 (down from $399 retail), AirPods Pro 2 with Hearing Aid functionality for just $169.99 (down from $249), and the M2 MacBook Air 13″ 16GB / 256GB model for just $699. What’s not to love about these great deals? Why pay more than you have to, check out the deals below!

Apple Watch Series 10 – $299 (down from $399)

Amazon is taking 25% off the price of brand new Apple Watch Series 10 models in various color and band options. Apple Watch Series 10 features a 42mm always-on display, fitness and activity tracking, heart rate monitor, ECG, crash detection, fall detection, Emergency SOS, ovulation tracking, GPS, pinch gestures, water resistance, voice control, Siri commands, all-day battery life, and more.

  • Get Apple Watch Series 9 for $299 (check out color options, down from $399 MSRP)

M2 MacBook Air 13″ for $699

Amazon is offering the M2 MacBook Air 13″ model for just $699 in the 16GB RAM / 256GB configuration, cutting 30% off the original $999 MSRP. Yes Apple just updated the MacBook Air lineup with M4 chips, but those start at $999, so if you’re looking to save some cash and you don’t mind having a prior generation chip, the M2 is available at a great place and is no slouch. The M2 chip supports Apple Intelligence and is speedy and energy efficient, making this a great portable Mac for an unusually low price point.

  • M2 MacBook Air 16/256 – $699

AirPods Pro 2 with Hearing Aid functionality – $169.99 (down from $249)

AirPod Pro 2 are both popular and powerful earbuds, but one of the most unique features of the wireless headphones is that they include clinic-grade hearing aid functionality that is appropriate for mild to moderate hearing loss. That’s in addition to the standard great AirPods Pro features, like high fidelity sound, active noise cancellation, Spatial Audio, water and sweat resistance, custom fit, transparency mode for ambient sounds, ear detection, Siri command support, and a USB-C charging case.

  • AirPods Pro 2 – $169.99 (down from $249)

AirTags 4-pack for $70 (down from $99)

Amazon is still offering a 4-pack of AirTag trackers for just $70, down from the $99 retail price. With four of these personal trackers you’ll be able to track everything you can think of, whether it’s keeping an eye on your dog, cat, briefcase, purse, luggage, package, backpack, car, bike, scooter, emotional support donkey, or whatever else you might find suitable to track with the powerful Apple Find My network.

  • AirTags – 4-pack – $69.99 (down from $99)

FTC: OSXDaily is an affiliate partner with Amazon, meaning if you click a link and make a purchase, we may receive a small payment which goes towards keeping the site running.
